body:
Hi @piggynl, thanks for the issue! 

> Currently some unit tests timeout on slow machines, with the following output.
> 
> ```
> Error: Timeout of 10000ms exceeded. For async tests and hooks, ensure "done()" is called; if returning a Promise, ensure it resolves.
> ```
> 
> Specifically, ~30 tests fail on both SiFive Unmatched RISC-V development board and `qemu-riscv64`.

Can you provide the complete output (the list of tests and hooks that are failing)?

rename.from: Change Request: Incresae unit test timeout in Makefile.js
rename.to: Change Request: Increase unit test timeout in Makefile.js

body:
Hi @mdjermanovic,

The number of failing tests varies between 10 and 40 all the time. Here are some collected outputs:
- (18 failing) http://fars.ee/eOj-
- (25 failing) http://fars.ee/15PI
- (27 failing) http://fars.ee/UVFB
- (28 failing) http://fars.ee/amat

If you want to setup a QEMU environment same as mine, the wiki page [Setup Arch Linux RISC-V Development Environment](https://github.com/felixonmars/archriscv-packages/wiki/Setup-Arch-Linux-RISC-V-development-environment) will help. You will need to run `pacman -S git nodejs npm` after the setup, then `git clone` or `node Makefile.js` as usual will be ok.

Thanks for the info! I thought the timeouts might have been caused by copying relatively large fixture directories in some `before` hooks (we already increased timeouts for some of them in https://github.com/eslint/eslint/pull/13768), but that doesn't seem to be the case here.

> Increase the timeout from 10s to 60s will solve.
> 
> https://github.com/eslint/eslint/blob/355b23d0c4e050be4e53292f552a47c10ec6e00e/Makefile.js#L81-L82

I'm not sure if it's a good idea to increase the timeout in all environments where we run tests, as that could hide performance issues we might have in the code.

Perhaps we could read this value from an environment variable (e.g., `ESLINT_MOCHA_TIMEOUT`) and use the default 10000 only if the variable was not set. Would that be helpful?
Certainly, it will be great! Shall I propose a PR on it?

> Certainly, it will be great! Shall I propose a PR on it?

Sounds good to me, it will be easier for the team to evaluate the change on the PR.

issue.title: chore: read `ESLINT_MOCHA_TIMEOUT` env var in Makefile.js

labels.name: feature
labels.description: This change adds a new feature to ESLint

labels.name: archived due to age
labels.description: This issue has been archived; please open a new issue for any further discussion

repository.name: eslint
repository.description: Find and fix problems in your JavaScript code.

issue.body:
#### Prerequisites checklist

- [x] I have read the [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/eslint/eslint/blob/HEAD/CONTRIBUTING.md).

#### What is the purpose of this pull request? (put an "X" next to an item)

[ ] Documentation update
[ ] Bug fix ([template](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/eslint/eslint/HEAD/templates/bug-report.md))
[ ] New rule ([template](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/eslint/eslint/HEAD/templates/rule-proposal.md))
[ ] Changes an existing rule ([template](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/eslint/eslint/HEAD/templates/rule-change-proposal.md))
[ ] Add autofix to a rule
[x] Add a CLI option
[ ] Add something to the core
[ ] Other, please explain:

This PR will close #15582.

#### What changes did you make? (Give an overview)

It allows `npm test` to override the default mocha tests timeout of 10000ms by reading `ESLINT_MOCHA_TIMEOUT` environment variable.

#### Is there anything you'd like reviewers to focus on?

<!-- markdownlint-disable-file MD004 -->
